Article.ArticleTitle: A Rapid User-Friendly Lab-on-a-Chip Microarray Platform for Detection of SARS-CoV-2 Variants.

AbstractText: Since the original SARS-CoV-2 virus emerged from Wuhan, China, in late December 2019, a number of variants have arisen with enhanced infectivity, and some may even be capable of escaping the existing vaccines. Here we describe a rapid automated nucleic acid microarray hybridization and readout in less than 15 min using the Fraunhofer lab-on-a-chip platform for identification of bacterial species and antibiotic resistance. This platform allows a fast adaptation of new biomarkers enabling identification of different genes and gene mutations, such as those seen in the case the SARS-CoV-2 variants.
